intro: Psychotria pachyantha, commonly known as the red-eyed cycad, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, strap-like leaves and distinctive red-colored flower clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Psychotria pachyantha plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
